revision.comment: Rescuing 4 sources and tagging 0 as dead. #IABot (v2.0beta5)
revision.text:
{{use mdy dates|date=December 2013}} {{Infobox person | name = Garry Shandling | image = GarryShandlingApr2011.jpg | caption = Shandling at the Night of Comedy 9 benefit in [[Beverly Hills, California]] on April 30, 2011 | birth_name = Garry Emmanuel Shandling | birth_date = {{birth date|1949|11|29}} | birth_place = [[Chicago]], Illinois, U.S. | death_date = {{death date and age|2016|3|24|1949|11|29}} | death_place = [[Los Angeles]], California, U.S. | alma_mater = [[University of Arizona]]{{cite web|url=http://arizonaalumni.com/garry-shandling|title=Garry Shandling|author=|date=July 18, 2013|website=arizonaalumni.com|accessdate=April 8, 2018}} | education = | spouse = | domestic_partner = [[Linda Doucett]] (1987–1994) | children = | parents = | signature = | years_active = 1975–2016 | footnotes = | website = | module = {{Infobox comedian|embed=yes | genre = [[Observational comedy]], satire, [[cringe comedy]] | medium = Stand-up, film, television | subject = [[Self-deprecation]], [[human interaction]], everyday life | notable_work = ''[[It's Garry Shandling's Show]]''
''[[The Larry Sanders Show]]'' }} }} '''Garry Emmanuel Shandling''' (November 29, 1949 – March 24, 2016) was an American stand-up comedian, actor, director, writer, and producer. He was best known for his work in ''[[It's Garry Shandling's Show]]'' and ''[[The Larry Sanders Show]]''. Shandling began his career writing for sitcoms, such as ''[[Sanford and Son]]'' and ''[[Welcome Back, Kotter]]''. He made a successful stand-up performance on ''[[The Tonight Show Starring Johnny Carson]]'' and became a frequent guest-host on the series. Shandling was for a time considered the leading contender to replace [[Johnny Carson]] (other hopefuls were [[Joan Rivers]], [[David Letterman]], and [[David Brenner]]). In 1986, he created ''It's Garry Shandling's Show'' for [[Showtime (TV network)|Showtime]]. It was nominated for four [[Emmy Award]]s (including one for Shandling) and lasted until 1990. His second show titled ''The Larry Sanders Show'', which began airing on [[HBO]] in 1992, was even more successful. Shandling was nominated for 18 Emmy Awards for the show and won the [[Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Writing for a Comedy Series]] in 1998, along with [[Peter Tolan]], for writing the series finale. In film, he had a recurring role in the [[Marvel Cinematic Universe]], appearing in ''[[Iron Man 2]]'' and ''[[Captain America: The Winter Soldier]]''. He also lent his voice to Verne the turtle in ''[[Over the Hedge (film)|Over the Hedge]]''. Shandling's final performance was as the voice of Ikki in the live-action remake of ''[[The Jungle Book (2016 film)|The Jungle Book]]''. During his three-decade career, Shandling was nominated for 19 Primetime Emmy Awards and two [[Golden Globe Award]]s, along with many other awards and nominations. He served as host of the [[Grammy Award]]s four times and as host of the [[Emmy Award]]s three times. ==Early life== Shandling was born '''Garry Emmanuel Shandling''' in [[Chicago]], Illinois,{{cite web|work=[[People (magazine)|People]]| url=https://www.people.com/people/archive/article/0,,20094137,00.html| title= Johnny Carson and Joan Rivers Can Agree on One Thing: Garry Shandling Is Perfect for Her Old Tonight Show Job|first1=Tim|last1=Allis|first2=Ron|last2=LaBrecque|date=July 21, 1986|volume=26|number=3|accessdate=January 18, 2013}} on November 29, 1949{{cite news|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/entertainment/garry-shandling-who-parodied-tvs-conventions-in-two-hit-comedy-shows-dies-at-66/2016/03/24/cc268cde-f1ff-11e5-85a6-2132cf446d0a_story.html|title=Garry Shandling, who parodied TV's conventions in two hit comedy shows, dies at 66|last=Schudel|first=Matt|date=2016-03-24 |last2=Bernstein|first2=Adam |newspaper=The Washington Post|language=en-US|issn=0190-8286|access-date=2016-03-25}} to a [[Jews|Jewish]] family. He grew up in [[Tucson, Arizona]], one of two sons of Irving Shandling (1919-1985), who owned ''Shandling Lithographic'', an art and academic print shop,{{cite web|url=https://www.amazon.com/dp/B001C77HA6|title=Ports of the United States. Report on terminal facilities, commerce, port charges, and administration at sixty-eight selected ports,|first1=Stanley A.|last1=Jones|first2=Ray|last2=Manley|first3=Stanley|last3=Fabe|date=April 10, 2018|publisher=Shandling Lithographic Co. Tucson|accessdate=April 10, 2018|via=Amazon}}{{cite web|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=ydggAQAAIAAJ&pg=PA3254&lpg=PA3254&dq=Shandling|title=Catalog of Copyright Entries. Third Series: 1971: July-December|author=|date=April 10, 1973|publisher=Copyright Office, Library of Congress|accessdate=April 10, 2018|via=Google Books}}{{cite web|url=https://www.amazon.com/dp/B001G0GWNW|title=The Vanishing Indian; Ray Manley: A Portfolio|first=Clara Lee|last=Tanner|date=April 10, 1983|publisher=Shandling Lithography|accessdate=April 10, 2018|via=Amazon}} and Muriel Estelle (née Singer) (1922-2011), proprietor of ''Muriel Shandling's Animal Fair'' a pet store,{{cite web|url=https://www.filmreference.com/film/43/Garry-Shandling.html|title=Garry Shandling profile|website=FilmReference.com|accessdate=March 24, 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160329055040/http://www.filmreference.com/film/43/Garry-Shandling.html|archive-date=March 29, 2016|dead-url=yes|df=mdy-all}}{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2007/01/28/arts/television/28stei.html?pagewanted=1|work=The New York Times|title=Hey Now: It's Garry Shandling's Obsession|first=Jacques|last=Steinberg|date=January 28, 2007|accessdate=April 2, 2010}}{{cite web|url=http://tucson.com/tucson-raised-comedian-garry-shandling-dies-at/article_6ed3f2fd-a32d-5bdd-b9fa-04ebe36a750f.html|title=Tucson-raised comedian Garry Shandling dies at 66|first=Cathalena E. |last=Burch|date=|website=Arizona Daily Star (tucson.com)|accessdate=April 10, 2018}}{{cite web|url=http://www.tributes.com/condolences/view_memories/91689991|title=Condolences for Muriel Shandling|author=|date=|website=tributes.com|accessdate=April 10, 2018}}{{cite web|url=https://www.newspapers.com/newspage/120920477/|title=Arizona Republic from Phoenix, Arizona · Page 11|author=|date=July 24, 1985|website=newspapers.com|accessdate=April 10, 2018}}{{cite web|url=https://company.usasearchs.com/company/5a2445413ba7bf6c11fe8fc8|title=Animal Fair, Tucson, AZ|author=|date=|website=company.usasearchs.com|accessdate=April 10, 2018}} with paternal grandparents Jacob Shandling, Anna Dodge from Russia and maternal grandparents Charles Singer from New York, and Aida Goovitsh from London. The family moved to Tucson so that Garry's older brother, Barry Philip (1947-1960),{{cite web|url=https://www.newspapers.com/newspage/17425299/|title=Tucson Daily Citizen from Tucson, Arizona on January 27, 1960 · Page 22|author=|date=|website=newspapers.com|accessdate=April 11, 2018}}{{cite web|url=https://www.geni.com/people/Barry-Shandling/6000000029840754174|title=Barry Philip Shandling|author=|date=|website=geni_family_tree|accessdate=April 11, 2018}}{{cite web|url=http://marycumminsrealestatemarycummins.blogspot.com/2016/03/garry-shandling-writer-comedian.html|title=Mary Cummins, investigative reporter, writer, speaker, activist in Los Angeles, California: Garry Shandling, writer, comedian - Obituary November 29, 1949 - March 24, 2016 - Los Angeles, California|author=|date=March 24, 2016|website=marycumminsrealestatemarycummins.blogspot.com|accessdate=April 11, 2018}} could receive treatment for [[cystic fibrosis]] and the hot dry air. Barry died of the disease when Garry was 10.{{cite web|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/7272564/garry-shandling-dead-66|title=Garry Shandling Dead at 66|work=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard.com]]|date=March 24, 2016|accessdate=March 24, 2016}} Shandling first obtained a ham radio license at age thirteen holding the callsigns W7BKG,{{cite web|url=http://wireless2.fcc.gov/UlsApp/UlsSearch/license.jsp?licKey=3479427|title=ULS License - Vanity License - W7BKG - Pelican Bay Amateur Radio Club|author=|date=|website=wireless2.fcc.gov|accessdate=April 11, 2018}} WN7BKG,{{cite web|url=http://hamtoons.net/these-are-the-cards-from-garrys-shack-the-cards-from-garry-shandlings-shack/|title=These are the cards from Garry’s shack, the cards from Garry Shandling’s shack …|author=|date=March 31, 2016|website=hamtoons.net|accessdate=April 11, 2018}} and WA7BKG (in 1969),https://archive.org/download/Fall_1969_Radio_Amateur_Callbook/Fall_1969_Radio_Amateur_Callbook_District_7.djvu{{cite web|url=https://archive.org/details/Fall_1969_Radio_Amateur_Callbook|title=Fall_1969_Radio_Amateur_Callbook|author=|date=April 11, 1969|publisher=|accessdate=April 11, 2018|via=Internet Archive}} belonging to ''Old Pueblo Radio Club'', {{cite web|url=http://www.oprc.org/node/1|title=Old Pueblo Radio Club - Old Pueblo Radio Club|author=|date=|website=www.oprc.org|accessdate=April 11, 2018}} ''The Rag Chewers Club'',{{cite web|url=http://www.qsl.net/k9fh/rcc.html|title=Rag Chewers Club|author=|date=|website=www.qsl.net|accessdate=April 11, 2018}} [[American Radio Relay League]], and sent [[QSL card]]s;{{cite web|url=https://archive.org/details/callbook|title=Amateur Radio Call Books : Free Texts : Download & Streaming : Internet Archive|author=|date=|website=archive.org|accessdate=April 11, 2018}} later holding the call sign KD6OY{{cite web|url=https://www.arnewsline.org/news/2016/3/31/amateur-radio-newsline-report-2005-april-1-2016.html|title=Amateur Radio Newsline Report 2005 April 1 2016|author=|date=|website=arnewsline.org|accessdate=April 11, 2018}}{{cite web|url=https://www.qrz.com/db1993/?callsign=KD6OY|title=QRZ.COM Ham Radio 1993 Callsign Database by QRZ.COM|accessdate=March 24, 2016}} and apparently let his license lapse some time in the 1990s. Shandling attended [[Palo Verde High School (Arizona)|Palo Verde High School]], sometimes reading his humorous class essays to classes. ==Career== After graduation from [[Palo Verde High School (Arizona)|Palo Verde High School]], he attended the [[University of Arizona]] in Tucson, majoring in [[electrical engineering]] for three years. One day after leaving a laboratory class for a drink of water, he couldn't bear rejoining the class. He eventually completed a degree in marketing and pursued a year of [[postgraduate studies]] in creative writing,{{cite web|url=https://variety.com/2016/tv/news/garry-shandling-dead-larry-sanders-show-show-1201738601|title=Garry Shandling Dies at 66|work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety.com]]|first=Alex|last=Stedman|date=March 24, 2016|accessdate=March 24, 2016}} and contributed humorous articles to small magazines. When he was nineteen, he drove two hours to a club in Phoenix, where he showed some jokes to George Carlin, who was appearing. The next day, on a repeat round-trip, Carlin told him that he had funny stuff on every page and should keep at it.{{cite web|url=https://www.newyorker.com/culture/sarah-larson/lots-of-love-for-garry-shandling|title=Lots of Love for Garry Shandling|first=Sarah|last=Larson|date=March 25, 2016|publisher=|accessdate=April 8, 2018|via=www.newyorker.com}}{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mvwyLSwR51c|title=Garry Shandling Interview Part 1 of 2 - EMMYTVLEGENDS.ORG|first=|last=FoundationINTERVIEWS|date=March 25, 2016|publisher=Archive of American Television|accessdate=April 8, 2018|via=YouTube}}{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tR-I_lxGG2k|title=Garry Shandling Interview Part 2 of 2 - EMMYTVLEGENDS.ORG|first=|last=FoundationINTERVIEWS|date=March 25, 2016|publisher=Archive of American Television|accessdate=April 8, 2018|via=YouTube}}{{cite web|url=https://www.vanityfair.com/hollywood/2017/03/garry-shandling-death-anniversary-jeffrey-tambor|title=One Year Later, Comedy’s Still Mourning Garry Shandling|first=Donald|last=Liebenson|date=|website=vanityfair.com|accessdate=April 8, 2018}} In 1973, Shandling moved to Los Angeles. He worked at an [[advertising agency]] for a time, took a script writing class, wrote a [[Spec script|speculative script]] with the son of a script writer, and then sold a script for the popular [[NBC]] sitcom ''[[Sanford and Son]]''.{{cite web|url=https://deadline.com/2016/03/comedian-writer-actor-and-producer-gary-shandling-dies-at-66-1201726026|title=Garry Shandling Dies: ‘Larry Sanders’ Creator-Star Was 66|first=Ross A.|last=Lincoln|website=[[Deadline Hollywood]]|date=March 24, 2016|accessdate=March 24, 2016}} In addition to ''Sanford and Son'', Shandling wrote scripts for the sitcoms ''[[Welcome Back, Kotter]]'' and attended a story meeting for ''[[Three's Company]]''.{{cite web|url=https://www.upi.com/Odd_News/2002/12/25/Cathys-World-Garry-Shandlings-Larry/52871040860003|title=Cathy's World: Garry Shandling's 'Larry'|accessdate=December 25, 2002}} In the late 1970s, Shandling was in an improv group with [[Paul Willson]].DVD commentary from ''It's Garry Shandling's Show'', season 2, episode 18, "No Baby, No Show" In 1977, Shandling was involved in an auto accident in [[Beverly Hills, California|Beverly Hills]] that left him in critical condition for two days and hospitalized for 2 weeks with a crushed spleen. During his hospital stay he had a life changing near death experience. Shandling stated, "I had a vivid near-death experience that involved a voice asking, "Do you want to continue leading Garry Shandling's life?" Without thinking, I said, "Yes." Since then, I've been stuck living in the physical world while knowing, without a doubt, that there's something much more meaningful within it all. That realization is what drives my life and work."{{Cite news|url=https://www.esquire.com/entertainment/interviews/a1949/esq0103-jan-shandling/|title=What I've Learned: Garry Shandling|date=2007-01-29|work=Esquire|access-date=2018-07-28|language=en-US}} The accident inspired him to pursue a career as a comedian,{{cite web| url=https://www.nytimes.com/1998/05/31/magazine/garry-shandling-goes-dark.html|title=Garry Shandling Goes Dark|first=Lynn|last=Hirschberg|work=The New York Times|date=May 31, 1998|accessdate=March 24, 2016}} and he later turned the accident into part of his comedy. ===Stand-up comedy=== Shandling became a stand-up comedian because, one day at a story meeting for "[[Three's Company]]," one of the producers had complained, "Well, Chrissie wouldn't say that."{{cite web|url=https://www.pastemagazine.com/articles/2012/09/catching-up-with-david-mirkin.html|title=Catching up with David Mirkin|author=|date=|website=pastemagazine.com|accessdate=April 10, 2018}}[[David Mirkin]]
"I just locked, I said, 'I don't think I can do this.' And I stopped right there and went on to perform." - Shandling{{cite web|url=https://www.upi.com/Cathys-World-Garry-Shandlings-Larry/52871040860003/|title=Cathy's World: Garry Shandling's 'Larry'|author=|date=|website=upi.com|accessdate=April 10, 2018}}
In 1978, Shandling performed his first stand-up routine at the [[The Comedy Store|Comedy Store]] in [[Los Angeles, California|Los Angeles]]. A year later, Shandling was one of the few performers to cross the picket line when a group of comedians organized a boycott against the Comedy Store, protesting owner [[Mitzi Shore]]'s policy of not paying comedians to perform. According to [[William Knoedelseder]], Shandling "was the scion of a family with ... decidedly antiunion views. He had not shared the struggling comic experience. He was a successful sitcom writer trying to break into stand-up, and prior to the strike, Shore had refused to put him in the regular lineup because she didn't think he was good enough. Of course, that changed the minute he crossed the picket line."{{cite web|last=Knoedelseder|first=William|year=2009|title=I'm Dying Up Here: Heartbreak and High Times in Stand-Up Comedy's Golden Era|publisher=Public Affairs Books|location=New York|pages=205–06|isbn=1-58648-896-1}} His persona was an anxiety-ridden, grimacing, guarded, confused man on the verge of losing control.{{cite web|url=https://forward.com/culture/336992/why-garry-shandling-was-one-of-the-greatest-jewish-comedians-ever/|title=Why Garry Shandling Was One of the Greatest Jewish Comedians Ever|author=|date=|website=forward.com|accessdate=April 1, 2018}} After a couple of years on the road, a talent scout from ''[[The Tonight Show Starring Johnny Carson]]'' booked him to appear as a guest in 1981. Shandling substituted for Carson on a regular basis until 1987, when he left to focus on his cable show leaving [[Jay Leno]] as permanent guest host and Carson's eventual successor.{{citation needed|date=March 2016}} In 1984, Shandling performed his first stand-up special ''Garry Shandling: Alone in Vegas'' for [[Showtime (TV network)|Showtime]],{{cite news|last=Erickson|first=Hal|url=https://movies.nytimes.com/movie/62749/Garry-Shandling-Alone-in-Las-Vegas/overview|title= Garry Shandling: Alone in Las Vegas (1984)|publisher=[[All Movie Guide]]|accessdate=June 23, 2009}} followed by a second televised special in 1986 titled ''The Garry Shandling Show: 25th Anniversary Special'', also for Showtime.{{cite web|url=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0363631|title=The Garry Shandling Show: 25th Anniversary Special (1986)|publisher=IMDB.com|accessdate= June 23, 2009}} In 1991, a third special titled ''Garry Shandling: Stand-Up'' was part of the ''[[HBO]] Comedy Hour''.{{cite news|url=https://tv.nytimes.com/show/48296/Garry-Shandling-Stand-Up/details|title=Garry Shandling: Stand-Up|publisher=The New York Times|accessdate=June 23, 2009}} ===Television series=== ====''It's Garry Shandling's Show''==== In 1985, Shandling and [[Alan Zweibel]] went on to create ''[[It's Garry Shandling's Show]]''. Through 1990, it ran for 72 episodes on [[Showtime (TV network)|Showtime]]. The edited reruns played on the [[Fox Broadcasting Company|Fox network]] beginning in 1988. Shandling wrote 15 episodes of the series. The series subverted the standard sitcom format by having its characters openly acknowledge that they were all part of a television series. Building on a concept that harked back to ''[[The George Burns and Gracie Allen Show]]'', in which [[George Burns]] would frequently break the "[[fourth wall]]" and speak directly to the audience, Shandling's series went so far as to incorporate the audience and elements of the studio itself into the storylines, calling attention to the artifice of the show.{{cite web|url=https://articles.latimes.com/2009/oct/20/entertainment/et-shandling20|title=Dollying through that fourth wall on 'It's Garry Shandling's Show': The funny guy deconstructed the sitcom on his Showtime series, which is newly out on DVD|first=Robert|last=Lloyd|work=[[Los Angeles Times]]|date=October 20, 2009|accessdate=March 24, 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160408040027/http://articles.latimes.com/2009/oct/20/entertainment/et-shandling20|archive-date=April 8, 2016|dead-url=yes|df=mdy-all}}{{cite web|url=http://eddieonfilm.blogspot.com/2010/09/garry-called-me-up-and-asked-if-i-would.html|title=Edward Copeland's Tangents: Garry called me up and asked if I would write this 25th anniversary tribute|first=Edward|last=Copel|date=|website=eddieonfilm.blogspot.com|accessdate=April 10, 2018}} The series was nominated for four Emmy Awards, including one for Shandling. He won an American Comedy Award for Funniest Male Performance in a Series, and won four CableACE awards, two for Best Comedy Series. The show also won an award for [[TCA Award for Outstanding Achievement in Comedy|Outstanding Achievement in Comedy]] from the [[Television Critics Association]].{{cite web|url=https://tvcritics.org/tca-awards|title=Past winners of the TCA Awards|publisher=[[Television Critics Association]]|accessdate=March 24, 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160401233500/http://tvcritics.org/tca-awards/|archive-date=April 1, 2016|dead-url=yes|df=mdy-all}} ====''The Larry Sanders Show''==== [[File:Garry Shandling (2077238844).jpg|thumb|upright|Shandling during the 1994 Emmy Awards rehearsals]] In 1992, Shandling launched another critical and commercial success by creating the mock behind-the-scenes talk show sitcom ''[[The Larry Sanders Show]]''. It was inspired by "It's Garry Shandling's Show." Season 4 Episode 2 "Take My Wife, for Example" It ran for 89 episodes through to 1998 on [[HBO]]. It garnered 56 [[Emmy Award]] nominations and three wins. Shandling based the series on his experiences guest hosting ''[[The Tonight Show Starring Johnny Carson]]''.{{cite web|title=Garry and Larry and Jeffrey and Hank|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2010/10/31/arts/television/31sanders.html|first=Dave|last=Itzkoff|work=The New York Times|date=October 29, 2010|accessdate=March 24, 2016}} In 1993, NBC offered Shandling $5 million to take over ''[[Late Night with David Letterman|Late Night]]'' when [[David Letterman]] announced his highly publicized move to [[CBS]], but Shandling declined.{{cite book|last=Carter|first=Bill|title=The War For Late Night|year=2010|isbn=0-452-29749-4|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=WUyzf2cJzu8C&pg=PT47|accessdate=March 25, 2016}} He was subsequently offered ''[[The Late Late Show (CBS TV series)|The Late Late Show]]'', but also declined in favor of continuing ''The Larry Sanders Show''. Shandling wrote 38 episodes of the series and directed three in the series' final season. He was nominated for 18 Emmy Awards for the series; five for acting, seven for writing, and six for being co-executive producer with [[Brad Grey]]. He won one Emmy Award for [[Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Writing for a Comedy Series|Outstanding Writing in a Comedy Series]] for the series finale "[[List of The Larry Sanders Show episodes#Season Six|Flip]]." He has also been nominated for two [[Golden Globe Award]]s for [[Golden Globe Award for Best Actor – Television Series Musical or Comedy|Best Actor (Musical or Comedy)]] in 1994 and 1995. He won two [[American Comedy Awards]] for Funniest Male Performance in a Comedy Series, eight [[CableACE Award]]s, and a [[BAFTA Award]]. The series also influenced other shows, such as ''[[Entourage (U.S. TV series)|Entourage]]'', ''[[30 Rock]]'', and ''[[Curb Your Enthusiasm]]'', in which guest stars portray themselves in episodes of the series.{{cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2007/01/28/arts/television/28stei.html|title=Hey Now: It's Garry Shandling’s Obsession|first=Jacques|last=Steinberg|work=The New York Times|date=January 28, 2007|accessdate=March 24, 2016}} In 2002, ''[[TV Guide]]'' named ''The Larry Sanders Show'' as 38th Greatest Show of All Time. In 2008, ''[[Entertainment Weekly]]'' ranked the series the 28th Best Show of the past 25 years. It was also included on ''[[Time (magazine)|Time]]'' magazine's 100 Greatest Shows of All Time.{{cite web|title=Garry Shandling Net Worth|website=CelebrityNetWorth.com|url=http://www.celebritynetworth.com/richest-celebrities/richest-comedians/garry-shandling-net-worth|accessdate=March 25, 2016}} The first season was re-released in 2007, along with a ''Not Just the Best of the Larry Sanders Show'', which were Shandling's pick of the best 23 episodes.{{cite web|url=http://www.ew.com/article/2007/04/12/not-just-best-larry-sanders-show|title=Not Just the Best of The Larry Sanders Show|publisher=Entertainment Weekly|website= EW.com|accessdate=March 24, 2016}} In October 2012, Shandling returned with fellow cast members from ''The Larry Sanders Show'' for ''[[Entertainment Weekly]]''’s Reunions issue. He was reunited with co-stars [[Rip Torn]], [[Jeffrey Tambor]], [[Sarah Silverman]], [[Penny Johnson Jerald]], [[Wallace Langham]], and [[Mary Lynn Rajskub]].{{cite web|url=http://www.ew.com/article/2012/10/12/reunions-2012-garry-shandling-larry-sanders-show|title='Larry Sanders' reunion|publisher=Entertainment Weekly|website= EW.com|accessdate=March 24, 2016}} ===Other work=== [[File:Shandling.jpg|thumb|right|Shandling at the 1992 [[Emmy Awards]]]] Shandling hosted the [[Grammy Award]]s in [[32nd Annual Grammy Awards|1990]], [[33rd Annual Grammy Awards|1991]], [[35th Annual Grammy Awards|1993]], and [[36th Annual Grammy Awards|1994]].{{cite web|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/garry-shandling-dies-12-little-878200|title=12 Little-Known Facts About Garry Shandling|author=|date=|website=hollywoodreporter.com|accessdate=April 8, 2018}} He hosted the [[Emmy Awards]] in [[52nd Primetime Emmy Awards|2000]] and [[56th Primetime Emmy Awards|2004]], and co-hosted (giving the opening monologue) in [[55th Primetime Emmy Awards|2003]]. He appeared occasionally in films, beginning with a cameo as Mr. Vertisey in ''[[The Night We Never Met]]''. He portrayed supporting roles in ''[[Love Affair (1994 film)|Love Affair]]'' and ''[[Mixed Nuts]]'', ''[[Dr. Dolittle (film)|Dr. Dolittle]]'' (1998) as the voice of a live-action [[pigeon]], the [[David Rabe]] play adaptation ''[[Hurlyburly (film)|Hurlyburly]]'' (1998), and ''[[Trust the Man]]'' (2001). Shandling wrote and starred in [[Mike Nichols]]' ''[[What Planet Are You From?]]'' (2000), and co-starred with [[Warren Beatty]] and others in ''[[Town & Country (film)|Town & Country]]'' (2001). In October 1999, Shandling, along with David Rensin, published ''Confessions of a Late Night Talk Show Host: The Autobiography of Larry Sanders'', written in the voice of his alter-ego Larry Sanders.{{cite web|url=http://www.cnn.com/books/reviews/9812/22/late.night/|title=The whole truth (and nothing but the truth) about Larry Sanders: 'Confessions of a Late Night Talk Show Host The Autobiography of Larry Sanders As Told to Garry Shandling' |first=L.D. |last=Meagher|work=CNN.com|accessdate=March 24, 2016}} He also appeared in a brief cameo in ''[[Zoolander]]'' (2001). Again voicing an animal, Shandling co-starred as Verne in ''[[Over the Hedge (film)|Over the Hedge]]'' (2006), which went on to become one of his best known roles.{{cite web| title=Close to the Edge to Over the Hedge; STAR TAKES TIME OUT FROM ACTION MOVIES TO MAKE A FILM FOR HIS KIDS Die Hard Star Bruce Goes Green and Cuddly| url= https://www.questia.com/article/1G1-147495379/close-to-the-edge-to-over-the-hedge-star-takes-time|work=Daily Record|first=Brian|last=McIver|location=Glasgow, Scotland|publisher=republished in questia.com}} He appeared in ''[[Iron Man 2]]'' (2010) as Senator Stern and reprised the role in ''[[Captain America: The Winter Soldier]]'' (2014). He appeared in an uncredited cameo as a health inspector in ''[[The Dictator (2012 film)|The Dictator]]'' (2012). In late 2006, [[Ricky Gervais]] interviewed Shandling{{cite web|url=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0934937/|title=Ricky Gervais Meets... Garry Shandling|author=|date=December 26, 2006|publisher=|accessdate=April 11, 2018|via=www.imdb.com}}{{cite web|url=http://www.bfi.org.uk/films-tv-people/4ce2b8c0cf46e|title=Ricky Gervais Meets Garry Shandling (2006)|author=|date=|website=bfi.org.uk|accessdate=April 11, 2018}}{{cite web|url=https://www.vice.com/en_us/article/dp5b47/garry-shandling-who-invented-comedy-as-we-know-it-is-dead|title=How Garry Shandling Invented Comedy as We Know It|author=|date=March 25, 2016|website=vice.com|accessdate=April 11, 2018}} for ''Ricky Gervais Meets...'', a [[United Kingdom|British]] documentary series,{{cite web|url=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0497435/|title=Ricky Gervais Meets... Larry David|author=|date=January 5, 2006|publisher=|accessdate=April 11, 2018|via=www.imdb.com}}{{cite web|url=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0934936/|title=Ricky Gervais Meets... Christopher Guest|author=|date=December 25, 2006|publisher=|accessdate=April 11, 2018|via=www.imdb.com}} citing him as a comic influence.{{cite news|date=April 27, 2006|url=https://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/entertainment/4951290.stm|title=Gervais to meet more comedy idols|publisher=BBC News|accessdate=July 23, 2007|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080307020531/http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/entertainment/4951290.stm|archive-date=March 7, 2008|dead-url=yes|df=mdy-all}} The reviews of British TV critics were mixed – one ''[[The Guardian|Guardian]]'' reviewer described it as "the uneasiest interview ever,"{{cite web|url=http://splitsider.com/2018/03/garry-shandling-and-ricky-gervaiss-epic-sparring-match/|title=Garry Shandling and Ricky Gervais’s Epic Sparring Match|author=|date=March 30, 2018|website=splitsider.com|accessdate=April 11, 2018}}{{cite web|url=https://thebaffler.com/latest/what-happened-to-ricky-gervais-james|title=What In God’s Name Happened To Ricky Gervais? - Brendan James|author=|date=March 22, 2018|website=thebaffler.com|accessdate=April 11, 2018}}{{cite web|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/tv/features/ricky-gervais-meets-garry-shandling-interview-video-episode-remembering-the-most-awkward-yet-human-a7571336.html|title=Ricky Gervais meets Garry Shandling: Remembering the most awkward yet human encounter in television history|author=|date=February 9, 2017|website=independent.co.uk|accessdate=April 11, 2018}}{{cite news|date=February 24, 2007|url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/theguide/features/story/0,,2018909,00.html|title=TV quick!|work=[[The Guardian]]|accessdate=July 23, 2007|location=London, UK| first=Eva|last=Wiseman}}{{cite web|url=https://6thfloor.blogs.nytimes.com/2012/01/11/how-ricky-gervais-deals-with-fame-and-the-famous/|title=How Ricky Gervais Deals With Fame and the Famous|first=Dave|last=Itzkoff|date=April 11, 2018|website=nytimes.com|accessdate=April 11, 2018}}{{cite web|url=https://austinfilmfestival.com/news/2006/05/08/shandling-interviewed-by-gervais/|title=Shandling interviewed by Gervais - Austin Film Festival|author=|date=May 8, 2006|website=austinfilmfestival.com|accessdate=April 11, 2018}}{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/stage/2013/dec/20/comedy-gold-garry-shandling-larry-sanders-show|title=Comedy gold: Garry Shandling|first=Leo|last=Benedictus|date=December 20, 2013|website=the Guardian|accessdate=April 11, 2018}}{{cite web|url=https://www.elle.com/culture/celebrities/a10386/ricky-gervais-339288/|title=Why Ricky Gervais is Britain's Most Riotous Improv Master|author=|date=August 26, 2009|website=elle.com|accessdate=April 11, 2018}}{{cite web|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131227125233/http://lonerboner.com/rickymeets|title=Gervais vs. Shandling - Loner Boner|author=|date=December 27, 2013|website=archive.org|accessdate=April 11, 2018}}{{cite web|url=http://gawker.com/garry-shandling-comedy-genius-is-dead-1766947045|title=Garry Shandling, Comedy Genius, Is Dead|first=Alex|last=Pareene|date=|website=gawker.com|accessdate=April 11, 2018}} another as Gervais' most interesting,{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.com/showbiz/news/a284213/shandling-explains-gervais-interview/|title=Shandling explains Gervais interview|author=|date=October 26, 2010|website=digitalspy.com|accessdate=April 11, 2018}}{{cite news|date=December 31, 2006|author=Flett, Kathryn|url=http://observer.guardian.co.uk/review/story/0,,1980339,00.html|title=Something to get your teeth into|work=The Guardian|accessdate=July 23, 2007|location=London}} but the general consensus was that it felt "awkward"{{cite web|date=December 23, 2006|author=French, Karl|url=http://search.ft.com/ftArticle?queryText=gervais+shandling&y=0&aje=true&x=0&id=061223000843|title=Television and Radio: Television|work=[[The Financial Times]]|accessdate=July 23, 2007}}{{dead link|date=December 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}{{cite news|date=March 22, 2007|author= Billen, Andrew|url=http://entertainment.timesonline.co.uk/tol/arts_and_entertainment/stage/comedy/article1549059.ece|title=No, I don't fear death – I'm just frightened of dying|work=[[The Times]]|accessdate=July 23, 2007|location=London, UK}}{{cite news|date=January 5, 2007|author=Deedes, Henry|url=http://news.independent.co.uk/people/pandora/article2125389.ece|title=By George, we salute you for your indefatigability|work=[[The Independent]]|accessdate=July 23, 2007|location=London, UK|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070815163929/http://news.independent.co.uk/people/pandora/article2125389.ece|archivedate=August 15, 2007|df=mdy-all}} due to both men's different comedic styles.{{cite news|date=January 6, 2006|author=John, Ian|url=http://entertainment.timesonline.co.uk/tol/arts_and_entertainment/film/article785278.ece|title=Ricky can't quite curb his enthusiasm|work=The Times|accessdate=July 23, 2007|location=London, UK}}{{cite news|date=January 28, 2007|author=Steinberg, Jacques|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2007/01/28/arts/television/28stei.html|title=Hey Now: It's Garry Shandling's Obsession|work=[[The New York Times]]|accessdate=March 29, 2008|authorlink=Jacques Steinberg}} In May 2011, Shandling was the featured guest on WTF with [[Marc Maron]].{{cite web|url=http://www.wtfpod.com/podcast/episodes/episode_177_-_garry_shandling|title=Episode 177 - Garry Shandling|author=|date=|website=wtfpod.com|accessdate=April 10, 2018}}{{cite web|url=http://www.wtfpod.com/podcast/episodes/remembering_garry_shandling|title=Remembering Garry Shandling|author=|date=|website=wtfpod.com|accessdate=April 10, 2018}} He starred as himself representing [[Fox Mulder]], alongside [[Téa Leoni]] as [[Dana Scully]] in ''[[The X-Files]]'' [[List of The X-Files episodes#Season 7 (1999–2000)|season 7]] spoof episode "[[Hollywood A.D. (The X-Files)|Hollywood A.D.]]"{{cite web|url=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0751136|title="The X Files" Hollywood A.D. (2000)|publisher=[[IMDB]]|accessdate=April 7, 2008}} In February 2010, Shandling was staying at the same [[Waipio Valley]] hotel that [[Conan O'Brien]] checked in to after his [[2010 Tonight Show conflict|departure from The Tonight Show]] and spent the entire vacation together, Shandling helping to rehabilitate O'Brien.{{cite web|url=https://www.gq.com/story/comedy-issue-garry-shandling|title=Garry Shandling: The Reclusive Master of American Comedy|first=Amy Wallace,Danielle|last=Levitt|date=August 12, 2010|website=gq.com|accessdate=April 11, 2018}}{{cite web|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/tv/news/watch-conan-obrien-remember-friend-garry-shandling-20160325|title=Watch Conan O'Brien Lovingly Remember Friend Garry Shandling|author=|date=|website=rollingstone.com|accessdate=April 11, 2018}}{{cite web|url=https://www.thedailybeast.com/articles/2016/03/25/conan-o-brien-on-how-garry-shandling-helped-save-his-life|title=Conan O’Brien on How Garry Shandling Helped Save His Life|first=Matt|last=Wilstein|date=March 25, 2016|publisher=|accessdate=April 11, 2018|via=www.thedailybeast.com}}{{cite web|url=http://www.etonline.com/news/185286_conan_o_brien_remembers_garry_shandling_helping_him_through_a_particularly_difficult_time|title=Conan O'Brien Remembers Garry Shandling: He Helped Me Through a 'Particularly Difficult Time in My Life'|author=|date=|website=etonline.com|accessdate=April 11, 2018}}{{cite web|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/arts-and-entertainment/wp/2016/03/25/conan-obrien-shares-emotional-garry-shandling-story-seth-meyers-pays-tribute/|title=Conan O’Brien shares emotional Garry Shandling story; Seth Meyers pays tribute|first=Emily|last=Yahr|date=March 25, 2016|publisher=|accessdate=April 11, 2018|via=www.washingtonpost.com}} In January 2016, Shandling was the featured guest on two different online shows. On January 13, Shandling appeared on episode 299 of the podcast ''[[You Made It Weird with Pete Holmes]]'',{{cite web|author=Staff|date=March 25, 2016|url=https://blogs.indiewire.com/theplaylist/conan-obrien-marc-maron-and-seth-meyers-pay-tribute-to-garry-shandling-20160325|title=Conan O'Brien, Marc Maron, And Seth Meyers Pay Tribute To Garry Shandling|publisher=Indiewire|accessdate=March 25, 2016}} which ran for over 2 hours and displayed many deeper, spiritual sides to Shandling, along with much spontaneous humor.{{original research inline|date=March 2016}} Just a week later, on January 20, ''[[Comedians in Cars Getting Coffee]]'' with [[Jerry Seinfeld]] debuted the now-poignantly titled episode "It's Great That Garry Shandling Is Still Alive."{{cite web|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160123213707/http://comediansincarsgettingcoffee.com/garry-shandling-its-great-that-garry-shandling-is-still-alive|title=Garry Shandling - It's Great That Garry Shandling Is Still Alive - Episode - Comedians In Cars Getting Coffee by Jerry Seinfeld|author=|date=January 23, 2016|website=archive.org|accessdate=April 8, 2018}}{{cite news|author=Sacks, Ethan|date=March 24, 2016|url=https://www.nydailynews.com/entertainment/tv/garry-shandling-acclaimed-comic-actor-dead-66-article-1.2576782|title=Garry Shandling, acclaimed comic and star of 'The Larry Sanders Show,' dead at 66|newspaper=Daily News|accessdate=March 25, 2016}} ==Personal life== Shandling was neither married nor had any children.Cleary, Tom (March 24, 2016). [https://heavy.com/entertainment/2016/03/garry-shandling-dead-cause-of-death-dies-age-bio-family-movies-shows-photos-video-funeral-hospitalized/ "Garry Shandling Dead: 5 Fast Facts You Need to Know"]. [[Heavy.com]]. He revealed little about his personal life. He shared an apartment with his fiancée [[Linda Doucett]] from 1987 until 1994; on ''The Larry Sanders Show'', Doucett portrayed Darlene, Hank Kingsley's doting assistant.{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2006/03/13/movies/13holl.html?pagewanted=all|work=The New York Times|first1=David M.|last1=Halbfinger|title=A Studio Boss and a Private Eye Star in a Bitter Hollywood Tale|date=March 13, 2006}} Shandling dated Sharon Stone{{cite web|url=http://www.wtfpod.com/podcast/episode-895-sharon-stone|title=Episode 895 - Sharon Stone|quote=Garry was my boyfriend|author=Marc Maron|date=March 5, 2018|website=WTF with Marc Maron Podcast|accessdate=April 17, 2018}} http://traffic.libsyn.com/wtfpod/WTF_-_EPISODE_895_SHARON_STONE.mp3 and reportedly dated [[Calista Flockhart]].{{cite web|url=http://www.tcm.com/tcmdb/person/185344%7C0/Sharon-Stone/companions.html|title=Companions for Sharon Stone|author=|date=|website=Turner Classic Movies|accessdate=April 8, 2018}}{{cite web|url=http://www.tcm.com/tcmdb/person/174921%7C0/Garry-Shandling/companions.html|title=Companions for Garry Shandling|author=|date=|website=Turner Classic Movies|accessdate=April 8, 2018}}{{cite web|url=http://www.tcm.com/tcmdb/person/63117%7C0/Calista-Flockhart/companions.html|title=Companions for Calista Flockhart|author=|date=|website=Turner Classic Movies|accessdate=April 8, 2018}} Shandling was a Buddhist{{cite web|url=https://www.gq.com/story/comedy-issue-garry-shandling|title=Garry Shandling: The Reclusive Master of American Comedy|first=|last=Amy Wallace, Danielle Levitt|date=August 12, 2010|website=gq.com|accessdate=March 23, 2018}}{{cite web|url=https://www.jta.org/2016/03/31/news-opinion/united-states/garry-shandling-to-have-buddhist-funeral|title=Garry Shandling to have Buddhist funeral|author=|date=|website=Jewish Telegraphic Agency|accessdate=April 1, 2018}}{{cite web|url=https://www.jta.org/2016/03/24/news-opinion/united-states/garry-shandling-comic-star-of-larry-sanders-show-dies-at-66|title=Garry Shandling, comic star of ‘Larry Sanders Show,’ dies at 66|author=|date=|website=Jewish Telegraphic Agency|accessdate=April 1, 2018}}{{cite web|url=http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/la-et-archives-garry-shandling-larry-sanders-show-dvd-20160324-story.html|title=With Garry Shandling, nothing was straightforward, including the DVD release of 'Larry Sanders Show'|first=Robert|last=Lloyd|date=|website=latimes.com|accessdate=March 23, 2018}}{{cite web|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/garry-shandling-celebrated-star-studded-887125|title=Garry Shandling's A-List Memorial: Penis Jokes, Buddhist Monks and a Johnny Depp Cameo|author=|date=|website=hollywoodreporter.com|accessdate=March 23, 2018}} who meditated, played a lot of basketball{{cite web|url=http://www.slate.com/blogs/browbeat/2016/03/28/an_annotation_of_that_photo_of_garry_shandling_s_friends_at_the_final_basketball.html|title=An Annotation of That Photo of Garry Shandling’s Comedian Friends at the Basketball Game They Played in His Honor|first=Laura|last=Bennett|date=March 28, 2016|publisher=|accessdate=April 10, 2018|via=Slate}}{{cite web|url=https://www.esquire.com/uk/culture/film/interviews/a11010/sacha-baron-cohen-what-ive-learned/|title=Sacha Baron Cohen: What I've Learned|author=|date=October 12, 2016|website=esquire.com|accessdate=April 8, 2018}} and boxed four times per week. Introduced to boxing by David Duchovny,{{cite web|url=https://www.alamy.com/stock-photo-garry-shandling-david-duchovny-lewis-vs-klitschko-boxing-match-staples-125581503.html|title=Stock Photo - GARRY SHANDLING & DAVID DUCHOVNY LEWIS VS. KLITSCHKO BOXING MATCH STAPLES CENTER LOS ANGELES USA 21 June 2003|first=|last=A|date=|website=Alamy|accessdate=April 10, 2018}}{{cite web|url=https://www.tvinsider.com/105458/david-duchovny-remembers-garry-shandling/|title=David Duchovny Remembers Garry Shandling|author=|date=|website=tvinsider.com|accessdate=April 10, 2018}} Shandling owned a boxing gym, ''TSB 44'' (Tough Strong Bold No. 44){{cite web|url=http://www.thesamohi.com/sports/in-the-ring-with-david-mijares|title=The Samohi » In the ring with David Mijares|author=|date=|website=thesamohi.com|accessdate=April 8, 2018}}{{cite web|url=http://www.myboxingfans.com/2012/08/photos-canelo-alvarez-in-santa-monica-california/|title=Photos: Canelo Alvarez in Santa Monica, California|author=|date=August 29, 2012|website=myboxingfans.com|accessdate=April 8, 2018}}{{cite web|url=https://www.cntraveler.com/stories/2011-02-10/a-day-in-the-life-of-a-screenwriter|title=A Day in the Life of a Screenwriter|first=Lesley Suter,Taffy|last=Brodesser-Akner|date= |website=cntraveler.com|accessdate=April 8, 2018}}{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kCddI3C-PQ4|title=Down for the Count: Gary Shandling|first=|last=|date=July 31, 2012|publisher=espn america|accessdate=April 8, 2018|via=YouTube}}{{cite web|url=http://articles.latimes.com/2012/aug/29/sports/la-sp-sn-shandling-canelo-boxing-20120829|title=Punchlines fly as Canelo Alvarez trains at Garry Shandling's gym|first=Lance|last=Pugmire|date=August 29, 2012|publisher=|accessdate=April 8, 2018|via=LA Times}} in [[Santa Monica, California]], along with [[Peter Berg]]{{cite AV media|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CIH-Rd8Apyg|title=T.V. legend Garry Shandling talks boxing in his Wild Card West gym.|date=February 19, 2014|accessdate=March 24, 2016|via=YouTube}} and boxing trainer David Paul, which in 2013 was renamed ''Wild Card West Boxing Club''.[[Freddie Roach (boxing)]]{{cite web|url=http://www.wildcardwest.com/about/|title=About|author=|date=|website=Wild Card West|accessdate=April 8, 2018}} ===Sexual harassment allegations=== In 1994, when Shandling and his fiancée [[Linda Doucett]] ended their relationship, Shandling had her dismissed from ''The Larry Sanders Show''. Doucett filed a lawsuit against Shandling and Brad Grey's production company, [[Brillstein Entertainment Partners]], for [[sexual harassment]] and wrongful termination. The case was settled out of court in 1997 for $1 million.{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2006/03/19/weekinreview/19halb.html?_r=1|work=The New York Times|first1=Allison Hope|last1=Weiner|first2=David M.|last2=Halbfinger|title=Splitting Up, Hollywood-Style, Means a Settlement and a Script|date=March 19, 2006|accessdate=March 24, 2016}}{{cite web|title=Hollywood Harassment: I Was Fired from a Hit Show and Intimidated By Lawyers|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/hollywood-harassment-i-was-fired-a-hit-show-intimidated-by-lawyers-guest-column-1053465|website=hollywoodreporter.com|publisher=The Hollywood Reporter}} In October 2017, television writer [[Janis Hirsch]], who wrote for ''[[It's Garry Shandling's Show]]'', alleged that another actor put his genitals on her shoulder in front of Shandling while in his office and nothing was done to reprimand the actor. Of Shandling, Hirsch wrote "Garry presided over a misogynistic writers room, where women (well, woman: it was just me) were called slits".{{cite web|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/i-worked-garry-shandling-judd-apatow-s-doc-shows-a-man-i-never-knew-guest-column-1097157|title=I Worked for Garry Shandling, and Judd Apatow’s Doc Shows a Man I Never Knew (Guest Column)|last=Hirsch|first=Janis|date=March 26, 2018|website=hollywoodreporter.com|publisher=The Hollywood Reporter|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}{{cite web|url=http://www.vulture.com/2017/10/sitcom-writer-recalls-harassment-on-garry-shandlings-show.html|title=Sitcom Writer Janis Hirsch Recalls Being Harassed and Humiliated While Working on It’s Garry Shandling’s Show|last=Wright|first=Tolly|date=October 18, 2017|website=vulture.com|publisher=Vulture|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}} ==Awards and nominations== Shandling won two [[British Comedy Awards]],{{cite web|date=March 24, 2016|url=https://www.rte.ie/ten/news/2016/0324/777309-us-comedian-garry-shandling-dies-aged/|title=US comedian Garry Shandling dies, aged 66|publisher=[[Raidió Teilifís Éireann|RTE]]|accessdate=March 24, 2016}} twelve [[CableACE Awards]] (including eight for ''The Larry Sanders Show'' and four for ''It's Garry Shandling's Show''), a BAFTA Award and was nominated for two [[Writers Guild of America Award]]s for ''The Larry Sanders Show''. He received three [[American Comedy Awards]],{{cite web|author=Roots, Kimberly|date=March 24, 2016|url=https://tvline.com/2016/03/24/garry-shandling-dead-the-larry-sanders-show-dies/|title=Garry Shandling Dead at 66|publisher=[[TVLine]]|accessdate=March 24, 2016}} two [[Satellite Award]] nominations,{{cite web|url=https://www.pressacademy.com/award_cat/1997|title=1997 Satellite Award Winners|publisher=[[International Press Academy]]|accessdate=March 24, 2016}} and in 2004, he was presented with the [[Austin Film Festival]]'s Outstanding Television Writer Award.{{cite news|title=Highlights from the festival|newspaper=Austin American Statesman|date=October 14, 2004|page=31}} ==Death== Shandling suffered from [[hyperparathyroidism]], a condition that can be fatal.{{cite web|url=https://www.theatlantic.com/health/archive/2016/04/garry-shandling-hyperparathyroidism/476445/|title=Garry Shandling and the Disease You Didn't Know About|last=Fallows|first=James|date=|website=theatlantic.com|accessdate=April 1, 2018}}{{cite web|url=https://www.theatlantic.com/notes/all/2016/04/the-parathyroid-papers-garry-shandling-and-a-little-known-disease/476646/|title=The Parathyroid Papers: Garry Shandling and a Little-Known Disease|last=Fallows|first=James|date=|website=theatlantic.com|accessdate=April 1, 2018}} On March 24, 2016, Shandling died in his home in [[Los Angeles]], [[California]], at age 66. The [[Los Angeles Police Department]] reported that he suddenly collapsed in his home and was rushed to a hospital,https://www.intouchweekly.com/posts/garry-shandling-death-linda-doucett-95418https://www.searchquarry.com/namesearch/results?fname=garry&lname=shandling&recordtype=Death&state=CA suffering from an apparent medical emergency. By the time the paramedics arrived, Shandling was unconscious. The autopsy showed that he died from a [[pulmonary embolism]].{{cite web|title=Garry Shandling Autopsy Report|url=http://www.tmz.com/2016/12/27/gary-shandling-cause-of-death|website=TMZ.com|publisher=TMZ}} ==Filmography== [[File:Garry Shandling at the 39th Emmy Awards cropped.jpg|thumb|upright|Shandling at the [[39th Primetime Emmy Awards]] in 1987]] ===Film=== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Year ! Title ! Role !
